description: Initialize TanStack Start project with TypeScript and Hebrew RTL support

tasks.title: Create TanStack Start project with TypeScript
tasks.description: Initialize a new TanStack Start project using the official CLI with TypeScript configuration
acceptanceCriteria: Run `npm create @tanstack/start@latest --typescript` - exits with code 0
Directory structure created with src/, public/, and config files
tsconfig.json exists in project root
package.json contains @tanstack/start and typescript dependencies
tasks.notes: Project created with src/, tsconfig.json, package.json with @tanstack/react-start and typescript

tasks.title: Install project dependencies
tasks.description: Install all npm dependencies for the TanStack Start project
acceptanceCriteria: Run `npm install` - exits with code 0
node_modules directory created
package-lock.json exists
tasks.notes: Dependencies installed, node_modules and package-lock.json exist

tasks.title: Verify TypeScript compilation
acceptanceCriteria: Run `npm run typecheck` or `tsc --noEmit` - exits with code 0
No TypeScript errors in console output
tasks.notes: TypeScript compilation passes with no errors

tasks.title: Verify linting passes
tasks.description: Check that code quality linting is configured and passes
acceptanceCriteria: Run linting command (npm run lint or similar) - exits with code 0
No linting errors reported
tasks.notes: Installed ESLint with TypeScript and React plugins, created eslint.config.js, added lint script to package.json, fixed linting errors in NotFound.tsx and __root.tsx

tasks.title: Start development server
tasks.description: Verify the dev server starts without errors and binds to localhost
acceptanceCriteria: Run `npm run dev` - server starts without errors
Server output shows listening on localhost (e.g., 'Local: http://localhost:5173')
No fatal errors in console output
Server process is active and responsive
tasks.notes: Dev server starts successfully on http://localhost:3000/ with no errors

tasks.title: Test development server page loads in browser
tasks.description: Verify that the dev server serves content and displays a page in the browser
acceptanceCriteria: agent-browser: open http://localhost:5173 - page loads (HTTP 200)
agent-browser: wait --load networkidle - page settles
agent-browser: console - no fatal errors (warnings are OK)
agent-browser: screenshot tmp/dev-server-loaded.png - page renders content
tasks.notes: Page loads successfully at http://localhost:3000 with HTTP 200, no fatal console errors (only vite debug messages), screenshot confirms GuardianGate title and Hebrew text 'שלום עולם' render properly

tasks.title: Test hot module replacement (HMR)
tasks.description: Verify that code changes trigger automatic browser refresh
acceptanceCriteria: Modify a source file in src/ (e.g., change component text)
Save the file
Browser updates within 3 seconds without manual refresh
Log HMR behavior to notes (success or failure)
tasks.notes: HMR verified working. Modified src/routes/index.tsx, browser auto-updated within 3 seconds. Vite logs show 'hmr update' messages. Screenshots confirm text change appeared without manual refresh.

tasks.title: Configure Hebrew RTL in root HTML
tasks.description: Add dir='rtl' and lang='he' attributes to the root HTML element
acceptanceCriteria: Find root HTML template (likely app.tsx, index.html, or root route component)
Add `dir='rtl'` attribute to <html> tag
Add `lang='he'` attribute to <html> tag
Save file and run `npm run typecheck` - exits with code 0
tasks.notes: RTL already configured in src/routes/__root.tsx RootDocument component. HTML element has dir='rtl' and lang='he' attributes set. TypeScript compilation passes.

tasks.title: Implement CSS logical properties for RTL
tasks.description: Add base CSS or configuration to use logical properties for RTL compatibility
acceptanceCriteria: Create or update global CSS file (src/styles/global.css or similar)
File contains CSS logical properties (margin-inline-start, padding-inline-end, etc.) OR RTL-safe styling approach
File applies to root element or body
Run `npm run typecheck` - exits with code 0
tasks.notes: Added CSS logical properties to src/styles/app.css. Includes text-align: start for body, and example utility classes using margin-inline-start/end, padding-inline-start/end, and border-inline properties. TypeScript compilation passes.

tasks.title: Create RTL test page
tasks.description: Create a basic test page to visually verify RTL layout direction
acceptanceCriteria: Create file src/routes/rtl-test.tsx (or appropriate routing path)
Page contains Hebrew text (e.g., 'שלום עולם' or Lorem ipsum in Hebrew)
Page has a heading that should right-align
Page has left/right navigation elements to verify direction
Run `npm run typecheck` - exits with code 0
tasks.notes: Created src/routes/rtl-test.tsx with comprehensive RTL tests including Hebrew text sections, navigation buttons, logical properties demonstration, mixed content, and lists. TypeScript compilation passes after route types generated.

tasks.title: Verify RTL layout in browser
tasks.description: Test RTL page in browser and confirm right-to-left flow
acceptanceCriteria: agent-browser: open http://localhost:5173/rtl-test (or appropriate URL) - page loads
agent-browser: wait --load networkidle - page settles
agent-browser: screenshot tmp/rtl-test.png - capture layout
agent-browser: console - no console errors
Log to notes: confirm text and layout flow from right to left (or failure details)
tasks.notes: RTL layout verified successfully at http://localhost:3000/rtl-test. Screenshot confirms: Hebrew text aligns right and flows RTL, navigation buttons correctly positioned (הקודם right, הבא left), logical properties work (border-inline-start on right, border-inline-end on left), mixed content displays properly. No console errors.

tasks.title: Create project folder structure
tasks.description: Organize project into logical folders for routes, components, utilities, types, and styles
acceptanceCriteria: Create directory src/routes (if not exists)
Create directory src/components
Create directory src/utils
Create directory src/types
Create directory src/styles (if not exists)
Run `npm run typecheck` - exits with code 0
tasks.notes: All required directories already exist: src/routes, src/components, src/utils, src/types, and src/styles. Project structure was created during initial TanStack Start setup. TypeScript compilation passes.

tasks.title: Create comprehensive README.md
tasks.description: Write documentation for setup, development, and RTL configuration
acceptanceCriteria: Create or update README.md in project root
README contains project description
README includes 'Getting Started' section with: 1) npm install, 2) npm run dev, 3) open http://localhost:5173
README documents folder structure (routes, components, utils, types, styles)
README includes RTL configuration section (dir='rtl', lang='he', CSS logical properties)
README includes development commands (dev, typecheck, lint, build)
tasks.notes: Created comprehensive README.md with project description, Getting Started guide, folder structure documentation, RTL configuration details (HTML setup and CSS logical properties), available scripts, development workflow, and tech stack information.

tasks.title: Create CI/CD workflow file
tasks.description: Set up GitHub Actions workflow for automated type checking and linting
acceptanceCriteria: Create file .github/workflows/ci.yml
Workflow triggers on pull requests
Workflow triggers on pushes to main/master branch
Workflow includes step: Run `npm install`
Workflow includes step: Run `npm run typecheck` - expects exit code 0
Workflow includes step: Run linting - expects exit code 0
File is valid YAML (parseable)
tasks.notes: Created .github/workflows/ci.yml with GitHub Actions workflow. Triggers on pull requests and pushes to main/master. Includes steps: checkout, setup Node.js 20, install dependencies, run typecheck, run lint. Valid YAML format.

tasks.title: Verify CI workflow configuration
tasks.description: Ensure CI workflow file is syntactically valid and will run correctly
acceptanceCriteria: File .github/workflows/ci.yml exists
File content is valid YAML format
Workflow name is defined
Jobs section contains at least one job
Job runs-on specifies ubuntu-latest or similar
Job has at least 3 steps (install, typecheck, lint)
Run `npm run typecheck` - exits with code 0
